intro: Sphaerostephanos melanophlebius, commonly known as the black-veined starwort, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, with dark veins on the petals. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or clay soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
